trans-unit.source: Creating a Driver Package
trans-unit.target: Creating a Driver Package

trans-unit.source: Driver projects and packages
trans-unit.target: Driver projects and packages

trans-unit.source: A driver *project* is the Microsoft Visual Studio project which produces a driver binary (such as a .sys file), and potentially the driver's INF file.
trans-unit.target: A driver *project* is the Microsoft Visual Studio project which produces a driver binary (such as a .sys file), and potentially the driver's INF file.

trans-unit.source: A driver *package* is the collection of files used to install a driver.
trans-unit.target: A driver *package* is the collection of files used to install a driver.

trans-unit.source: The package includes an INF file, and files and binaries referred to by that INF.
trans-unit.target: The package includes an INF file, and files and binaries referred to by that INF.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio uses driver packages to automatically deploy and debug your driver to a remote target.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio uses driver packages to automatically deploy and debug your driver to a remote target.

trans-unit.source: A driver package is a separate project which collects output from one or more projects, such as driver projects.
trans-unit.target: A driver package is a separate project which collects output from one or more projects, such as driver projects.

trans-unit.source: The driver package's project, when built, then produces the driver package which Visual Studio uses to deploy the driver.
trans-unit.target: The driver package's project, when built, then produces the driver package which Visual Studio uses to deploy the driver.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Solution Explorer Driver Package Project
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Solution Explorer Driver Package Project

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: If you use a driver template to create a driver solution, then the template should automatically create a solution that contains two projects.
trans-unit.target: If you use a driver template to create a driver solution, then the template should automatically create a solution that contains two projects.

trans-unit.source: One for the driver, and another for the driver package.
trans-unit.target: One for the driver, and another for the driver package.

trans-unit.source: Manually creating a driver package
trans-unit.target: Manually creating a driver package

trans-unit.source: If your solution does not have a driver package, you can manually create one in Visual Studio by choosing **New > Project** from the **File** menu.
trans-unit.target: If your solution does not have a driver package, you can manually create one in Visual Studio by choosing **New > Project** from the **File** menu.

trans-unit.source: For examples of how to create a driver package, see [Writing Your First Driver](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff554811).
trans-unit.target: For examples of how to create a driver package, see [Writing Your First Driver](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff554811).

trans-unit.source: To manually create a new driver package for an existing solution that does not already have one, use the "Driver Install Package" template.
trans-unit.target: To manually create a new driver package for an existing solution that does not already have one, use the "Driver Install Package" template.

trans-unit.source: Select **New > Project** from the **File** menu.
trans-unit.target: Select **New > Project** from the **File** menu.

trans-unit.source: Then select **Windows Driver > Package > "Driver Install Package"** from the dialog.
trans-unit.target: Then select **Windows Driver > Package > "Driver Install Package"** from the dialog.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio will associate the newly created driver package with all the driver projects that were present in the solution when the driver package is created.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio will associate the newly created driver package with all the driver projects that were present in the solution when the driver package is created.

trans-unit.source: Modifying an existing driver package
trans-unit.target: Modifying an existing driver package

trans-unit.source: If your solution already contains a driver package, you can modify it to reference other projects in the solution.
trans-unit.target: If your solution already contains a driver package, you can modify it to reference other projects in the solution.

trans-unit.source: Right-click on the driver package and select **Properties...**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on the driver package and select **Properties...**.

trans-unit.source: Expand **Common Properties** and select **References**.
trans-unit.target: Expand **Common Properties** and select **References**.

trans-unit.source: You can add a reference to other projects in the solution by clicking **Add New Reference...** and selecting the project to reference.
trans-unit.target: You can add a reference to other projects in the solution by clicking **Add New Reference...** and selecting the project to reference.

trans-unit.source: To remove a reference to an existing project, first highlight the existing project you no longer want to reference, then click **Remove Reference**.
trans-unit.target: To remove a reference to an existing project, first highlight the existing project you no longer want to reference, then click **Remove Reference**.

trans-unit.source: Driver Package Properties
trans-unit.target: Driver Package Properties

trans-unit.source: Multiple drivers in a solution
trans-unit.target: Multiple drivers in a solution

trans-unit.source: You can add multiple drivers and their packages to your solution.
trans-unit.target: You can add multiple drivers and their packages to your solution.

trans-unit.source: Similar to "Modifying an existing driver package" you can create a new driver solution, or add a reference to an existing one.
trans-unit.target: Similar to "Modifying an existing driver package" you can create a new driver solution, or add a reference to an existing one.

trans-unit.source: If your solution already contains a driver package, you can modify it to reference additional driver projects in the solution.
trans-unit.target: If your solution already contains a driver package, you can modify it to reference additional driver projects in the solution.

trans-unit.source: Right-click on the existing driver package and select **Properties...**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on the existing driver package and select **Properties...**.

trans-unit.source: Expand **Common Properties** and select **References**.
trans-unit.target: Expand **Common Properties** and select **References**.

trans-unit.source: You can add a reference to other projects in the solution by clicking **Add New Reference...** and selecting the project to reference.
trans-unit.target: You can add a reference to other projects in the solution by clicking **Add New Reference...** and selecting the project to reference.

trans-unit.source: To remove a reference to an existing project, first highlight the existing project you no longer want to reference, then click **Remove Reference**.
trans-unit.target: To remove a reference to an existing project, first highlight the existing project you no longer want to reference, then click **Remove Reference**.

trans-unit.source: See the "Toaster Sample Driver" sample for an example of a single solution that contains multiple drivers:
trans-unit.target: See the "Toaster Sample Driver" sample for an example of a single solution that contains multiple drivers:

trans-unit.source: Multiple Drivers in a Single Solution
trans-unit.target: Multiple Drivers in a Single Solution
